Description: St Peter, St Diego and St Antony Abbot with a donor; two of them seated, looking up to the head of Christ in clouds, trees behind Pen and brown ink, with brown wash, heightened with white (partly oxidised), over black chalk, on pale blue paper
Curator's comments: A finished study for a signed painting dated 1593 now in the Palazzo Nievo in Vicenza (Puppi, 1963, fig. 126). According to the artist's 'Giornale' (Puppi, 1968, pp. 102-3), Pietro Paolo Pancera commissioned the painting for a church in Cologna. The half-length figure at the lower right is a portrait of the patron's father Gianantonio. The painting is close to the drawing differing in only minor details, such as the addition of a cross held in Saint Diego's right hand. The present drawing may be the one mentioned in the artist's 'Giornale'. Lit: M. Piacentini, 'Dipinti e disegni italiani in Atene', "L'Arte", 1942, p. 18, fig. 11; L. Puppi, 'Appunti su Paolo Farinati', "Arte Veneta", XVII, 1963, pp. 116 and 118, n. 57; L. Puppi, 'Paolo Farinati, Giornale (1573-1606)', Florence, 1968, p. 103, fig. 33
Associated names: Representation of: St Diego of Alcala
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
